byline.contributor: Greg Bishop reported from Zanesville, Ohio, and Timothy Williams from New York. Leslie Kaufman and J. David Goodman contributed reporting from New York and Barclay Walsh contributed research.

abstract: Zanesville, Ohio, sheriff's office reports that preserve owner Terry Thompson cut open wire cages of exotic animals before killing himself with gun; 49 of 56 animals that fled have been hunted down and killed, while remaining six were tranquilized and are being held at Columbus Zoo and Aquarium.
snippet: Terry Thompson, of Zanesville, Ohio, killed himself and then was apparently bitten, officials said Thursday. The wound was “consistent with a tiger bite,” the sheriff said.
lead_paragraph: Terry Thompson, of Zanesville, Ohio, killed himself and then was apparently bitten, officials said Thursday. The wound was “consistent with a tiger bite,” the sheriff said.

headline.main: Preserve Owner Was Bitten by Big Cat, Authorities Say
headline.print_headline: Aftermath at the Animal Preserve: A Mauled Corpse and Now a Mass Grave
headline.seo: Preserve Owner Was Bitten By Big Cat, Authorities Say
